channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Honest Company CEO Carla Vernón on being mentored by Walmart’s Doug McMillon
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Home Depot’s 7.5-foot Christmas Chewbacca is the next Skelly
item.description: Nothing says “Merry Christmas” quite like a 7.5-foot-tall Chewbacca holding a candy cane. At least, according to the team at Home Depot. Home Depot ha...

item.title: This incredible map shows the world’s 2.75 billion buildings
item.description: From the latest skyscraper in a Chinese megalopolis to a six‑foot‑tall yurt in Inner Mongolia, researchers at the Technical University of Munich claim...

item.title: The Best Brands on Social Media Have This in Common
item.description: Why “ready, fire, aim” beats perfection when it comes to your social strategy.

item.title: 6 End of Year Tax Strategies for Small Businesses
item.description: Tips from tax and money experts on the best way to trim your tax bill before the end of the year.

item.title: Inside True Religion’s surprising turnaround
item.description: Six years ago, when Michael Buckley returned to True Religion ‘s offices as CEO, the denim brand looked nothing like the one he had built a decade ear...

item.title: Asia will get steady growth next year, defying global headwinds, says Mastercard’s chief APAC economist
item.description: Asia is contributing more to global growth than the Americas or Europe, says Mastercard's David Mann.

item.title: The most influential leaders say less and listen more. Here’s why
item.description: Leadership listening is in sharp decline, and the consequences run deep. A survey from People Insights found that only 56% of employees believe senior...

item.title: Jeff Bezos Says Successful People Find Ways to Make a Lot Fewer Decisions
item.description: According to Bezos, two or three decisions a day should be the goal.

item.title: Surf the web like it’s 2022 with Slop Evader
item.description: It’s hard to believe that just a few short years ago a video of Will Smith eating spaghetti generated by ModelScope, a text-to-video AI model, was the...

item.title: Tariffs are taxes and they were used to finance the federal government until the 1913 income tax. A top economist breaks it down
item.description: The last major U.S. tariff law was the Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act of 1930, which established an average tariff rate of 20% on all imports by 1933.

item.title: Sheryl Sandberg breaks down why it’s a troubling time for women in the workplace right now
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of working women left the U.S. workforce this year, while issues of gender stereotyping, workplace harassment, and lackluster ca...

item.title: Social Capital: The Best CFOs in the Business Share How They Turn High Follower Counts Into Higher Valuations
item.description: Introducing Inc.’s 2025 Best in Business Entrepreneurial CFOs.

item.title: The Problem With Sending Your AI Agent to Meetings, According to Neuroscience
item.description: Yes, attending through an AI tool is a time saver, but there are serious tradeoffs.

item.title: Leading the agentic enterprise: What the next wave of AI demands from CEOs
item.description: With agentic AI on board, companies must rethink their very makeup: how work is designed, how decisions are made, and how value is created.
